Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Change default dependents and GH used by to top 50 sorted by downloads/stars and allow users to see all" (#10266) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

_No response_

### The Elevator Pitch

We should increase this job/number to 50 by default and then provide a means to allow someone to "view all" which can load a separate page or even download a file that includes the entire used by list. These lists should still keep their sorting by popularity.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b0e8d7bd-6331-4b93-bf58-db29c2e9e8b5)

Other examples:

https://www.npmjs.com/package/react?activeTab=dependents

https://www.npmjs.com/browse/depended/react


### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Show .Net 9 in list of frameworks" (#10265) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

.Net 9 is live, but nuget doesn't show it in list of supported frameworks for any package. For example:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/C1.WPF.Schedule#supportedframeworks-body-tab
https://www.nuget.org/packages/C1.ScheduleCore/#supportedframeworks-body-tab
https://www.nuget.org/packages/C1.DataCollection/9.0.20242.202-preview
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8447655d-6141-4c19-9879-8f21ce0fd858)

The last shown version is .Net 8

### The Elevator Pitch

please make sure that net9.0 and net9.0-platform is correctly computed and shown everywhere

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add .NET 9 TFM checkbox" (#10264) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/5512

Add new filtering checkbox for the .NET 9 TFM.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2545849a-4042-48bc-a0c3-9f26eafa0517)

*NOTE:* The backend index changes needed to support this are still in progress. I'll wait to merge this till we have that in place.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet package manager does not respect selected "FrameworkVersion" on Update in Package manager UI" (#13926) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - Current Version 17.12.0

### Worked before?

NO

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

After Release of new .NET Version for example as .NET 9.0 was released it is not more possible to Upgrade packages correctly.

Example in Directory.Build.props we have following line

<TargetFramework>net8.0</TargetFramework>, which is explicitly specify that we want to use only LTS 8.0 version of .NET

If I start update packages to the latest version, there are components offered which support  only .NET 9.0, but not .NET 8.0
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.NewtonsoftJson version 9.0.0 is only available for .NET 9.0.

This breaks the whole procedure and lead to errors!

Please fix it


### Verbose Logs

```shell
Error message:
Package Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.NewtonsoftJson 9.0.0 is not compatible with net8.0 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v8.0). Package Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.NewtonsoftJson 9.0.0 supports: net9.0 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v9.0)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash] The readme.txt is shown on the left of PM UI window instead of the “README” tab in the PM UI after installing the package “Castle.Core” " (#13925) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.13.0.63

### Worked before?

It’s not a regression since it is a new feature.

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Details about problem
NuGet Version: Dev\6.13.0.63
VS Version: Main\35513.67
OS: Windows-11-Enterprise-23H2

#### Notes:   
1.	The repro rate is 100%.  
2.	Clicking the refresh button doesn’t work. 
3.	It’s not a regression since it is a new feature. 
#### Repro Steps:    
1.	Create a “C# Console App (.NET 9.0)” project.    
2.	Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open the PM UI.    
3.	Click “Browse” tab and select the source “nuget.org” from Package source drop-down list. 
4.	Install the package “Castle.Core” and switch to “Installed" tab. 

#### Expected Result:
The readme file should show in the “README” tab in the PM UI.

#### Actual Result:
The readme.txt is shown on the left of PM UI window instead of the “README” tab in the PM UI as the screenshot below.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b41af875-c8e0-4be8-af13-bffec86bf89e)


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash] The “README” tab doesn’t show in the right panel of the PM UI after installing package" (#13924) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.13.0.63

### Worked before?

It’s not a regression since it is a new feature. 

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:    

1. Create a “C# Console App (.NET 9.0)” project.    

2. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open the PM UI.    

3. Click “Browse” tab and select the source “nuget.org” from Package source drop-down list. 

4. Install a package (e.g. RestSharp) and switch to “Installed" tab. 

5. Observe the details panel on the right panel of PM UI.  

#### Expected:    

The “README” tab should show in the right panel as below. 
![1114](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a20c196e-d38c-42ea-b7f9-d332f46a59e8)
#### Actual:    

The “README” tab doesn’t show in the right panel of the PM UI after installing package as below screenshot:  
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a1a4f1e5-0d5f-48b5-98ce-721038486ee2)


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test:  test certificate not removed after test completion" (#13923) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[This certificate](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/38729596a6549df3cd1eed37b93d51df1bf62bff/test/NuGet.Core.Tests/NuGet.Commands.Test/CertificatesFixture.cs#L22-L28) is added to the current user's personal store but not removed.

The reason is because `GetTrustedCertificate()` returns the private copy of the certificate, which is then disposed by the caller.  When `CertificatesFixture.Dispose()` executes, the certificate cannot be found (and removed) because the certificate has already been disposed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
